title: 1st Year College
description: This is my first time I get to experience programming. Starting with C++, where I learned the basics such as input and output operations, basic mathematical functions, and conditional statements like if and else. In addition to programming, I worked extensively with AutoCAD, creating detailed 2D floor plans of various sizes and layouts. For my 3D projects in AutoCAD, I successfully designed digital models of fundamental parts such as frames and casings. These experiences have provided me with a solid foundation, providing me the skills and knowledge that I constantly apply up to this day. It applies both programming and digital design, which enhances my problem-solving skills and technical proficiency.

title: 2nd Year College
description: This is where my experience with web development has came to a start. I got introduced to basic html and css, and this is where I got exposed to full-stack development for the first time.  We are tasked to create a full-stack project using python and Django REST framework as our backend. This is where I also got study about electronics, what are the various components, what they do, and how they should applied. Though it is more on a textbook approach I have yet to experience handling electronics later on. Throughout the 2nd semester of this school year, we are tasked to study React.js and this is where my interest to front-end design has started.

title: Highlights
description: I thrive on turning ideas into reality through the creation of different projects. Here are a few highlights of my work: I have ported the Marauder firmware onto my own ESP32 development board, which enables Wi-Fi/Bluetooth penetration capabilities. In addition to my hardware and firmware skills, I am actively learning and honing my expertise in HTML, CSS, React.js, and Next.js. But, I can also do back-end functions with the Django REST framework.

title: Hobbies/Skills
description: I am passionate about keyboard building and modding, as well as PC building and optimizing Windows software. I also have experience in mobile device repair, including replacing common parts. My interests include working on hardware projects like the ESP32 and playing table tennis as a student athlete. I am dedicated to web development, actively working on projects, and continuously studying new programming languages. Above all, I strive to constantly learn and expand my knowledge in all areas of technology.
